content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Factory Burner Inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
– Cable Factory Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Dedicated Burner Inserter at (3.5, 17.5)
– Assembling Machine at (1.5, 19.5)

### Wooden Chest Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden Chest (serving as belt depot) at (3.5, 15.5)
– Transport Belt Segment adjacent to the depot at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot Burner Inserter at (3.5, 14.5)

### Electricity Generator at (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Steam Engine at (–0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)

### Extraction System Interface at (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
– Associated Wooden Chest at (–3.5, 26.5)

### Research Lab (Electrical ID: 7106)
Consists of the following entity:
– Lab with input {'automation-science-pack': 17} (position not specified)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– When connecting a multi‐segment transport belt, avoid targeting a steam engine directly. Use an inserter to feed items into the steam engine instead.
– For placement errors due to excessive distance, ensure the player moves closer to the intended position so that the distance does not exceed the allowed maximum.
– When an entity cannot be placed because it is missing from the inventory (e.g. “No wooden_chest in inventory”), verify and manage the inventory to include the required item before placing.
– In cases of variable name errors (e.g. “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined”), double‐check that the correct and defined variable names (such as target_pos or depot_chest) are being used.
